head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: 20 Years For Killing Father

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: 20 Years For Killing Father

block.p: A Queens woman who killed her father by striking him with a hammer in 2004 was sentenced to 20 years in prison yesterday, prosecutors said. The woman, Laura Martin, 46, pleaded guilty last month in State Supreme Court to manslaughter, said Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said Ms. Martin was charged with beating her father, John Martin, 67, with a hammer in their Long Island City home and then going out to buy drugs. She told the police that he had been attacked during a break-in, Mr. Brown said.
A Queens woman who killed her father by striking him with a hammer in 2004 was sentenced to 20 years in prison, prosecutors said.
